description.raw:
Replace the installation of [packages.osrfoundation.org](http://packages.osrfoundation.org) repository \(sources.list and add key\) on Linux to use the [feature added to gazebo developers tool ](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/6)\(see [README](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/README.md)\).

The goal is to have a single tool for installing the appropriate repositories \(stable, prerelease, nightly\) with a s[ingle point of configuration](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml) that can serve in our different CI services \(bitbucket-pipelines, travis or jenkins\).

The tool can work using [the configuration file](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml#L14), variable `GZDEV_PROJECT_NAME`, or if the variable is not present, by doing simple calls \(i.e: `gzdev repository enable osrf prerelease)` I migrated most of the compilation jobs to use configuration but left others to use single calls \([logic added here to dockerfiles](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/new#Ljenkins-scripts/docker/lib/docker_generate_dockerfile.bashT32)\).

Testing:

* ignition-gazebo2 using configuration stable \+ prerelease:

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1800)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/1800/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1800/))

    
    
* sdformat install using no configuration but single calls

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/badge/icon)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8\_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/))

    
    
* travis in sdformat repo 

    * [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8)
description.html:
Replace the installation of packages.osrfoundation.org repository (sources.list and add key) on Linux to use the feature added to gazebo developers tool (see README).

The goal is to have a single tool for installing the appropriate repositories (stable, prerelease, nightly) with a single point of configuration that can serve in our different CI services (bitbucket-pipelines, travis or jenkins).

The tool can work using the configuration file, variable GZDEV_PROJECT_NAME, or if the variable is not present, by doing simple calls (i.e: gzdev repository enable osrf prerelease) I migrated most of the compilation jobs to use configuration but left others to use single calls (logic added here to dockerfiles).

Testing:

  • ignition-gazebo2 using configuration stable + prerelease:

    • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1800/)

  • sdformat install using no configuration but single calls

    • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/)

  • travis in sdformat repo

    • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8

title.raw: Use gzdev tool to install repositories

description:
Replace the installation of [packages.osrfoundation.org](http://packages.osrfoundation.org) repository \(sources.list and add key\) on Linux to use the [feature added to gazebo developers tool ](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/6)\(see [README](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/README.md)\).

The goal is to have a single tool for installing the appropriate repositories \(stable, prerelease, nightly\) with a s[ingle point of configuration](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml) that can serve in our different CI services \(bitbucket-pipelines, travis or jenkins\).

The tool can work using [the configuration file](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml#L14), variable `GZDEV_PROJECT_NAME`, or if the variable is not present, by doing simple calls \(i.e: `gzdev repository enable osrf prerelease)` I migrated most of the compilation jobs to use configuration but left others to use single calls \([logic added here to dockerfiles](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/new#Ljenkins-scripts/docker/lib/docker_generate_dockerfile.bashT32)\).

Testing:

* ignition-gazebo2 using configuration stable \+ prerelease:

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1800)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/1800/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1800/))

    
    
* sdformat install using no configuration but single calls

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/badge/icon)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8\_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/))

    
    
* travis in sdformat repo 

    * [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8)
